lom_description: Esta presentación se presenta como una introducción para trabajar con los alumn@s todo el tema relacionado con las tecnoadicciones y el uso responsable del teléfono móvil.En la Slide 1: se introduce el tema llevando a los alumnos a qu ese den cuenta de que hay muchas adicciones en el mundo que les rodea.En la Slide 2: se le muestra al alumno un vídeo con una serie de cuestiones a las que debe ir respondiendo de forma personal.En la Slide 3: se ve que si la mayoría de mis respuestas son positivas puede ser que tengo un problema respecto a la dependencia que tengo del móvil, o si por el contrario son negativas (o los alumnos que en primer lugar han dado al positivo), ven que pautas pueden o deben seguir para hacer un uso responsable del móvil, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Concienciar a los alumn@s sobre el uso adecuado del teléfono móvil y los problemas de adicción en los que pueden caer., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://educainternet.es/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Presentación enriquecida (y gratis) sobre NOMOFOBIA. Esta presentación se presenta como una introducción para trabajar con los alumn@s todo el tema relacionado con las tecnoadicciones y el uso responsable del teléfono móvil.
En la Slide 1: se introduce el tema llevando a los alumnos a qu ese den cuenta de que hay muchas adicciones en el mundo que les rodea.
En la Slide 2: se le muestra al alumno un vídeo con una serie de cuestiones a las que debe ir respondiendo de forma personal.
En la Slide 3: se ve que si la mayoría de mis respuestas son positivas puede ser que tengo un problema respecto a la dependencia que tengo del móvil, o si por el contrario son negativas (o los alumnos que en primer lugar han dado al positivo), ven que pautas pueden o deben seguir para hacer un uso responsable del móvil

lom_description: Existen páginas en Internet que plantean temas no adecuados para nadie y en especial para usuarios jóvenes. Es el caso de sitios que tratan de fomentar el racismo, violencia, terrorismo, armas, sectas, pornografía infantil, abusos infantiles, tráfico de drogas, anorexia o bulimia, etc. En muchos casos la policía descubre y cierra algunas de estas páginas pero a veces las tareas de investigación judicial llevan su proceso y estos sitios permanecen publicados durante un cierto periodo de tiempo. En otros casos los contenidos están reservados solo para personas adultas: pornografía, apuestas, etc., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lom_description: This Inquiry Learning Space is designed for young Chemistry students of lower secondary school (12-15 years old) and aims at introducingan atom’s main "building blocks": protons, neutron and electrons.Students will “build” atoms through the addition or removal of protons, neutrons and electrons. Through this activity they will discover in a fun, interactive and easy way: * The position of each particle in an atom * The charge of each particle and how this contributes to the charge of an   atom * The link of the number of particles with the mass and atomic number of an   atom * The link of the number of protons with the position of an element in the   atomic table.Students will also be introduced to the first and second energy level, the stability or instability of an atom and a teacher can decide whether to use the orbit or the cloud model.The learning approach is divided into two activities:/Activity 1: “Atom”/In this activity students “build” four different atoms. They do this by adding or removing particles to their atoms, through dragging them in and out of the atom model. During this activity, the online lab notes the net charge of the atom and its mass number, as well as the element’s name, whether it is neutral or an ion and whether it is stable or not./Activity 2: “Symbol”/Once again, students add or remove protons, electrons and neutrons to an atom, but this time focus on the symbol of the atom (including the mass and atomic number) and its position in the periodic table., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Build an atom. This Inquiry Learning Space is designed for young Chemistry students of lower 
secondary school (12-15 years old) and aims at introducingan atom’s main 
"building blocks": protons, neutron and electrons.

Students will “build” atoms through the addition or removal of protons, 
neutrons and electrons. Through this activity they will discover in a fun, 
interactive and easy way:

 * The position of each particle in an atom
 * The charge of each particle and how this contributes to the charge of an
   atom
 * The link of the number of particles with the mass and atomic number of an
   atom
 * The link of the number of protons with the position of an element in the
   atomic table.

Students will also be introduced to the first and second energy level, the 
stability or instability of an atom and a teacher can decide whether to use 
the orbit or the cloud model.

The learning approach is divided into two activities:

/Activity 1: “Atom”/

In this activity students “build” four different atoms. They do this by 
adding or removing particles to their atoms, through dragging them in and out 
of the atom model. During this activity, the online lab notes the net charge 
of the atom and its mass number, as well as the element’s name, whether it 
is neutral or an ion and whether it is stable or not.

/Activity 2: “Symbol”/

Once again, students add or remove protons, electrons and neutrons to an 
atom, but this time focus on the symbol of the atom (including the mass and 
atomic number) and its position in the periodic table.

lli_title: Biodiversity of plants,birds and animals - ViSH
lom_description: Welcome! /Plant Diversity/ .Environmental pollution has an adverse effect on plants especially those medicinal that have beneficial effects on the health of the body.The main causes of the disappearance of plant and animal species are: destruction of habitats, commercial exploitation (the collection of plants, hunting and poaching irrational), the damage produced by acclimatized species and pollution. Of these cases, the destruction of Habitat is the greatest threat to these species.Maintaining existing ecosystems, such as coral reefs, forests, or swamps, depends largely on their biodiversity. The disappearance of one of the species that make up a food chain can lead to the decline of the ecosystem in question. Irreversible decline of biodiversity has a serious impact on the living standards of the people. Healthy ecosystems provide food, clean air, water and fertile soil for agriculture. Also, 40% of modern drugs are derived from plants and animals., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Biodiversity of plants,birds and animals. Welcome! /Plant Diversity/ .Environmental pollution has an adverse effect on 
plants especially those medicinal that have beneficial effects on the health 
of the body.The main causes of the disappearance of plant and animal species 
are: destruction of habitats, commercial exploitation (the collection of 
plants, hunting and poaching irrational), the damage produced by acclimatized 
species and pollution. Of these cases, the destruction of Habitat is the 
greatest threat to these species.Maintaining existing ecosystems, such as 
coral reefs, forests, or swamps, depends largely on their biodiversity. The 
disappearance of one of the species that make up a food chain can lead to the 
decline of the ecosystem in question. Irreversible decline of biodiversity 
has a serious impact on the living standards of the people. Healthy 
ecosystems provide food, clean air, water and fertile soil for agriculture. 
Also, 40% of modern drugs are derived from plants and animals.

lli_title: Analysis of cola drinks in a virtual lab - ViSH

lom_description: Το φαινόμενο της σκιά ήταν ανέκαθεν ξεκαθαρισμένο ως απουσία φωτός. Ο Αριστοτέλης, μάλιστα, είχε επιχειρηματολογήσει υπέρ μιας σφαιρικής γης πιστεύοντας ότι οι καμπύλες γραμμές στη σεληνιακή επιφάνεια δημιουργούνται από τη σκιά μιας σφαιρικής γης, που παρεμβάλλεται ανάμεσα στον ήλιο και το φεγγάρι (Grant 2011, p.95). Η παρούσα διδακτική πρόταση, για μαθητές τυπικής ανάπτυξης και μαθητἐς με ειδικές εκπαιδευτικές ανάγκες ή/και αναπηρία, είναι η συμμετοχή στο διαγωνισμό Εκπαιδευτικού Σεναρίου τουOpen Discovery Space (ODS) 2014-15. Ανήκει στο διερευνητικό μοντέλο μάθησης και έμφαση δόθηκε στη σύνδεση του περιεχομένου με την καθημερινή ζωή, στην εκπαίδευση μεταξύ ομοτίμων (Νεράντζης 2014, Πιερράτος 2013) και στις μεγάλες ιδέες της επιστήμης (Harlen 2010). Αυτή η διδακτική πρόταση υποστηρίζεται από ένα σχέδιο διδασκαλίας (δείτε εδώ: http://wp.me/p3oRiZ-eW) και Χώρους Διερευνητικής Μάθησης χώρους (ILS) στα Ελληνικά και Αγγλικά. Οι μαθητές εργάζονται σε ομάδες και καλούνται να συμμετάσχουν σε μια διερεύνηση του φαινομένου της σκιάς με χρήση διαδραστικού πίνακα και του μαθησιακού αντικειμένου «Σκιά – Παρασκιά” από photodentro.edu.gr (δείτε εδώ http://goo.gl/iwW0zh). Επιπλέον, με τη σχρήση μεταμνημονικών ερωτἠσεων στοχεύεται η αυτο-ρύθμιση της μάθησης μέσωμέσω των κρίσεων μάθησης (Judgments of Learning, JOLs) και των κρίσεων ευκολίας της µάθησης (Ease of Learning, EOLs) (Καραγιάννη 2013 – σελ.8, Karably & Zabrucky 2009)., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

lli_title: IMPLANTACIÓN PROYECTO IPAD EN EL COLEGIO ALBA - RODOLFO  SÁNCHEZ JIMÉNEZ
lom_description: En este trabajo, he decidio explicar de manera resumida el proyecto de implantación, desde el punto de vista tecnológico, seguridad informática y pedagógico, de las tabletas en el colegio ALBA de Torrejón de Ardoz. La idea es que le pueda servir a cualquier otro centro que este interesado en seguir estos pasos.En mi opinión casa perfectamente con la temática del curso, pero desde una perspectiva diferente.Es algo que yo no he encontrado en internet y creo que puede ser muy útil., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Dirigida a equipos docentes, que quieran implantar un proyecto de tabletas en su centro. Por tanto es una experiencia completamente práctica que he decidido compartir libremente en la red., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://educainternet.es/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Presentación enriquecida (y gratis) sobre IMPLANTACIÓN PROYECTO IPAD EN EL COLEGIO ALBA. En este trabajo, he decidio explicar de manera resumida el proyecto de implantación, desde el punto de vista tecnológico, seguridad informática y pedagógico, de las tabletas en el colegio ALBA de Torrejón de Ardoz. La idea es que le pueda servir a cualquier otro centro que este interesado en seguir estos pasos.
En mi opinión casa perfectamente con la temática del curso, pero desde una perspectiva diferente.
Es algo que yo no he encontrado en internet y creo que puede ser muy útil.

lom_description: Students will use the experimental data collected by the ATLAS experiment at CERN to “discover” invisible particles and calculate their mass. For this purpose they will identify different lepton types and use Einstein’s famous equation for the equivalence of mass and energy. They will also us vector addition to add the momenta of several particles which are the decay products of the invisible particles. The particle they will be looking for is the particle responsible for the weak force, the Z boson., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Discover the Z boson. Students will use the experimental data collected by the ATLAS experiment at 
CERN to “discover” invisible particles and calculate their mass. For this 
purpose they will identify different lepton types and use Einstein’s famous 
equation for the equivalence of mass and energy. They will also us vector 
addition to add the momenta of several particles which are the decay products 
of the invisible particles. The particle they will be looking for is the 
particle responsible for the weak force, the Z boson.

lom_title: A flexible open source web platform to facilitate Learning Object evaluation evaluation
lli_title: A flexible open source web platform to facilitate Learning Object evaluation evaluation - Aldo
lom_description: This paper presents LOEP, an open source web platform that aims to facilitate Learning Object evaluation in different scenarios and educational settings by supporting and integrating several evaluation models and quality metrics. The work exposed in this paper shows that LOEP is capable ofproviding Learning Object evaluation to e-Learning systems in an open, low cost, reliable and effective way. , This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., This paper presents LOEP, an open source web platform that aims to facilitate Learning Object evaluation in different scenarios and educational settings by supporting and integrating several evaluation models and quality metrics. , License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lli_title: Propiedades de los materiales - Xabier Sorbet Mantxo
lom_description: Propiedades de los materiales industriales. Ejercicios con solución., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Obtiene los datos de los materiales de elementos de máquinas, relacionando las características de los mismos con sus requerimientos, funcionales, técnicos y económicos.Criterios de evaluación:a) Se han relacionado las propiedades físicas, químicas y mecánicas de los materiales con las necesidades de los elementos.b) Se ha relacionado la influencia existente entre los procesos de fabricación y las propiedades del material.c) Se han relacionado los tratamientos térmicos y termoquímicos empleados respecto de sus efectos sobre los materiales.d) Se ha identificado la necesidad de protección o lubricación en los materiales usados.e) Se ha identificado la influencia de las propiedades del material en el desarrollo de los procesos de mantenimiento industrial., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

lli_title: Tipología de las fortificaciones - Mikel Rodríguez
lom_description: Finalizada la Guerra Civil, Franco decidió la fortificación de la frontera con Francia. Con ese objetivo se iniciaron las obras que, con mayor o menor intensidad, prosiguieron hasta una fecha tan avanzada como 1957. Por su particular emplazamiento el valle del Baztán constituía una posible vía para la hipotética invasión aliada y debido a ello fue de las zonas con mayor densidad de obras defensivas construidas. A continuación estudiaremos los principales tipos de fortificación, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., 1. Conocer la realidad del valle del Baztan durante el primer franquismo.2. Comprender la táctica militar de la época y visualizar su presencia en la actualidad. 3. Mostrar preocupación por las atrocidades de la represión franquista.4. Creación e interpretación de fuentes iconográficas referidas a esta cuestión.5. Utilización de fuentes arqueológicas referidas a esta cuestión.6. Revalorización del patrimonio cercano como una fuente de enriquecimiento cultural y económico., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description: Slides presentation about Tipología de las fortificaciones. Finalizada la Guerra Civil, Franco decidió la fortificación de la frontera con Francia. Con ese objetivo se iniciaron las obras que, con mayor o menor intensidad, prosiguieron hasta una fecha tan avanzada como 1957. Por su particular emplazamiento el valle del Baztán constituía una posible vía para la hipotética invasión aliada y debido a ello fue de las zonas con mayor densidad de obras defensivas construidas. A continuación estudiaremos los principales tipos de fortificación

lom_description: En esta unidad se trabajan contenidos gramaticales relacionados con la estructura de la frase, la declinación, haciendo hincapié en el uso del dativo, verbos y preposiciones que rigen dativo, así como el uso del pronombre posesivo en todas sus formas.Los verbos modales son también un elemento de repaso, su empleo debe surgir espontáneamente  y no generar ningún problema. Las situaciones de comunicación que debes aprender están relacionadas con comer y beber en cualquier contexto: en casa, con amigos en el restaurante, etc. Además debes saber desenvolverte haciendo la compra. Conversar sobre este tema con amigos debe surgir de manera fluida.Finalmente podrás entender las ideas principales y la comprensión selectiva de textos tanto orales como escritos relacionados con este tema y adecuados a tu nivel.Junto con tus compañeros elaborarás un dossier con vuestras recetas favoritas., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Essen und Trinken. En esta unidad se trabajan contenidos gramaticales relacionados con la estructura de la frase, la declinación, haciendo hincapié en el uso del dativo, verbos y preposiciones que rigen dativo, así como el uso del pronombre posesivo en todas sus formas.

Los verbos modales son también un elemento de repaso, su empleo debe surgir espontáneamente  y no generar ningún problema. 

Las situaciones de comunicación que debes aprender están relacionadas con comer y beber en cualquier contexto: en casa, con amigos en el restaurante, etc. Además debes saber desenvolverte haciendo la compra. Conversar sobre este tema con amigos debe surgir de manera fluida.

Finalmente podrás entender las ideas principales y la comprensión selectiva de textos tanto orales como escritos relacionados con este tema y adecuados a tu nivel.

Junto con tus compañeros elaborarás un dossier con vuestras recetas favoritas.

lom_title: ¿Cómo identifico azúcares de la familia de la glucosa?Identificación de azúcares reductores
lli_title: ¿Cómo identifico azúcares de la familia de la glucosa?Identificación de azúcares reductores - Jose Viñas
lom_description: Los azúcares reductores contienen un grupo aldehídico(-COH) libre que les confiere su poder reductor. Un ejemplo de estos azúcares es la glucosa.La determinación de glucosa es de importancia médica ya que niveles sanguíneos alterados pueden ser signo de una enfermedad metabólica común conocida como diabetes mellitus., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., - Reforzar los conocimientos adquiridos por el estudiante acerca de los  carbohidratos mediante la demostración experimental de algunas de sus propiedades.- Adquirir habilidades propias del método indagativo como :    - Identificar y especificar el objetivo de la experiencia y sus variables.    -  Relacionar el plan o procedimiento de trabajo  a las variables propuestas.    -  Elaborar hipótesis.    -  Organizar los datos obtenidos.    -  Interpretar los resultados.    -  Tiene en cuenta las posibles fuentes de error __    -   Las variables se indican en la conclusión     -  Proponer conclusiones en base a los objetivos propuestos por el profesor.- Adquirir habilidades manuales en el laboratorio: mechero, medición en pipeta, elaboración de disoluciones., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about ¿Cómo identifico azúcares de la familia de la glucosa?Identificación de azúcares reductores. Los azúcares reductores contienen un grupo aldehídico(-COH) libre que les confiere su poder reductor. Un ejemplo de estos azúcares es la glucosa.
La determinación de glucosa es de importancia médica ya que niveles sanguíneos alterados pueden ser signo de una enfermedad metabólica común conocida como diabetes mellitus.

lli_title: A flexible open source web platform to facilitate Learning Object evaluation evaluation - aldo
lom_description: This paper presents LOEP, an open source web platform that aims to facilitate Learning Object evaluation in different scenarios and educational settings by supporting and integrating several evaluation models and quality metrics. lli_title: Biodiversitatea in Delta Dunarii  - Lidia Ristea
lom_description: Omul își desfășoară activitatea într-un mediu natural format  din mai  multe sisteme ecologice .Conservarea biodiversităţii la nivel de ecosisteme, specii şi populaţii a devenit din ce în ce mai dificilă pentru că în ultimii ani  s-a deteriorat capitalul  natural  cu efecte complexe pe termen lung, datorat în mare parte intensificării  impactului uman.Unul din motivele pentru care Delta Dunării a devenit rezervaţie a biosferei este acela că, în comparaţie cu alte delte ale Europei şi chiar ale Terrei, a păstrat o biodiversitate mai ridicată, prin aceasta întelegându-se un număr mare de specii dintr-o mare diversitate de unităţi sistematice. Mai mult decât  atât, Delta Dunării frapează prin densitatea ridicată la multe specii, care sunt rare sau lipsesc din alte zone ale continentului, cu toate că din cauza efectelor activităţilor antropice din ultimele decenii şi efectivele acestor specii ca şi habitatele lor au fost grav afectate., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Creşterea gradului de conştientizare a elevilor şi cadrelor didactice privind problemele de mediu , dezvoltarea spiritului critic şi a capacităţii elevilor de a lua decizii  prin  popularizarea  , amenajarea şi pastrarea spaţiului verde si  protejarea  tuturor speciilor  din Delta Dunării.  , License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Biodiversitatea in Delta Dunarii . Omul își desfășoară activitatea într-un mediu natural format  din mai  multe sisteme ecologice .
Conservarea biodiversităţii la nivel de ecosisteme, specii şi populaţii a devenit din ce în ce mai dificilă pentru că în ultimii ani  s-a deteriorat capitalul  natural  cu efecte complexe pe termen lung, datorat în mare parte intensificării  impactului uman.
Unul din motivele pentru care Delta Dunării a devenit rezervaţie a biosferei este acela că, în comparaţie cu alte delte ale Europei şi chiar ale Terrei, a păstrat o biodiversitate mai ridicată, prin aceasta întelegându-se un număr mare de specii dintr-o mare diversitate de unităţi sistematice. 
Mai mult decât  atât, Delta Dunării frapează prin densitatea ridicată la multe specii, care sunt rare sau lipsesc din alte zone ale continentului, cu toate că din cauza efectelor activităţilor antropice din ultimele decenii şi efectivele acestor specii ca şi habitatele lor au fost grav afectate.

lli_title: Bisel method in Hungary - Agnes Bocsok
lom_description: The Biotic IndexThe Biotic Index (BI) is a biological water quality assessment method for water courses. It is a simple method that permits one to gain a clear insight into the ecological quality of water courses with very limited means. Biological water quality assessment is a valuable supplement to chemical water quality assessment systems, scientifically as well as educationally.The Belgian variant (Belgian Biotic Index, BBI) was set and repeatedly tested by a cooperation of several laboratories. Since 1984 it is the offical standard method for biological water quality assessment in Belgium. This BBI  has proven to be much more applicable, with slight adaptations, than merely in Belgium, at  least all over Europe.Concerning application at the secondary education level the  BBI has one big advantage compared to other methods (standardized elsewhere in Europe): the assessment of the biotic index is quick, easy and requires no work for a specialist or big investments.In the educational field the BI integrates in an active way (field work) the biology lessons  of classifications and ecology: the  determination of the macro invertebrates is based on the principles of  the biological classification system and its interpretation in terms of water quality is connected with human influences on the environment. When the assessment of the biotic index is combined with chemical water  analyses, clear conclusions can (mostly) be drawn concerning the cause of the pollution and thus we have an integration of the biology and chemistry lessons., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Method:1. Sampling: try to catch as many various species of water organisms as possible.2. Sample processing: identify and enumerate them. 3. Interpretation: classify them according to their sensibility to water pollution and express your results as a score for the biological water quality., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Bisel method in Hungary. The Biotic Index
The Biotic Index (BI) is a biological water quality assessment method for water courses. It is a simple method that permits one to gain a clear insight into the ecological quality of water courses with very limited means. Biological water quality assessment is a valuable supplement to chemical water quality assessment systems, scientifically as well as educationally.
The Belgian variant (Belgian Biotic Index, BBI) was set and repeatedly tested by a cooperation of several laboratories. Since 1984 it is the offical standard method for biological water quality assessment in Belgium. This BBI  has proven to be much more applicable, with slight adaptations, than merely in Belgium, at  least all over Europe.
Concerning application at the secondary education level the  BBI has one big advantage compared to other methods (standardized elsewhere in Europe): the assessment of the biotic index is quick, easy and requires no work for a specialist or big investments.
In the educational field the BI integrates in an active way (field work) the biology lessons  of classifications and ecology: the  determination of the macro invertebrates is based on the principles of  the biological classification system and its interpretation in terms of water quality is connected with human influences on the environment. When the assessment of the biotic index is combined with chemical water  analyses, clear conclusions can (mostly) be drawn concerning the cause of the pollution and thus we have an integration of the biology and chemistry lessons.

lli_title: testing the drinking water - Agnes Bocsok
lom_description: Testing the quality of drinking waterOne of our Comenius project aims was test drinking water quality of each country.We used for it the AQUANAL – Water Laboratory, which contains six tests onsubstances dissolved in water. Ammonium, Nitrate, Nitrite, Phosphate, ph-value andTotal hardness. The test result is determined from a color chart.The examination of the four „indicators” already mentioned for the pollution of water(nitrate, nitrite, ammonium and phosphate), along with the determination of waterhardness and the ph value, will produce a clear picture of the quality of the water., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lli_description:
Slides presentation about testing the drinking water. Testing the quality of drinking water
One of our Comenius project aims was test drinking water quality of each country.
We used for it the AQUANAL – Water Laboratory, which contains six tests on
substances dissolved in water. Ammonium, Nitrate, Nitrite, Phosphate, ph-value and
Total hardness. The test result is determined from a color chart.
The examination of the four „indicators” already mentioned for the pollution of water
(nitrate, nitrite, ammonium and phosphate), along with the determination of water
hardness and the ph value, will produce a clear picture of the quality of the water.

lom_title: Around the world - the school trip around the world with t-shirts, books, geography and fieldwork swirled.
lli_title: Around the world - the school trip around the world with t-shirts, books, geography and fieldwork swirled. - Ina Randic Dordevic
lom_description: 1.stage: "Collecting t-shirts"Students collect t-shirts with a sign on it: name of cites, countries, states, rivers... T-shirts are sorted and analyzed by geographical area and region. Studenst prepare an exhibition of t-shirts in the school hall and classrooms.2.stage: "Telling a story"Lectures and workshops with guests (travel writers, sailors, adventurers and world travelers). Reading and researching travelogues and logbooks.3.stage: "Sail around, fly and experience the world"Creating an itinerary according to the collected shirts by land, see and air. Writing a travel guide.4.stage: "Mathematical Adventures"Calculate the itinerary using the coordinate system.5.stage: "Cultural similarities and differences"Research cultural similarities and differences according to collected t-shirts.6.stage:"Fieldrip"boat ride, visit some place according to collected t-shirts, find and visit a partner-school7.stage: Evaluations, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Around the world - the school trip around the world with t-shirts, books, geography and fieldwork swirled.. 1.stage: "Collecting t-shirts"
Students collect t-shirts with a sign on it: name of cites, countries, states, rivers... T-shirts are sorted and analyzed by geographical area and region. Studenst prepare an exhibition of t-shirts in the school hall and classrooms.

2.stage: "Telling a story"
Lectures and workshops with guests (travel writers, sailors, adventurers and world travelers). Reading and researching travelogues and logbooks.

3.stage: "Sail around, fly and experience the world"
Creating an itinerary according to the collected shirts by land, see and air. Writing a travel guide.

4.stage: "Mathematical Adventures"
Calculate the itinerary using the coordinate system.

5.stage: "Cultural similarities and differences"
Research cultural similarities and differences according to collected t-shirts.

6.stage:"Fieldrip"
boat ride, visit some place according to collected t-shirts, find and visit a partner-school

7.stage: Evaluations

A través de este vídeo-juego se intenta que el usuario defina las distancias entre las palabras. El análisis semántico es un gran desafío para la ciencia y la innovación, ya que es una tarea muy compleja que requiere de modelos avanzados y validaciones de expertos. lom_description: GripeNet.es es una herramienta cuyo objetivo primordial es monitorizar la incidencia de la gripe en España a través de la colaboración desinteresada y anónima de voluntarios vía Internet. El proyecto tiene un doble propósito. Por una parte, los datos recogidos permitirán a los investigadores avanzar en el conocimiento de los mecanismos de propagación de las enfermedades infecciosas y, por otra, el proyecto constituirá una herramienta de divulgación para acercar la ciencia al ciudadano e involucrarlo directamente en el estudio científico a través de la información facilitada.  ¡Participa tú también y ayúdanos a prevenir la gripe en España!, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

El proyecto tiene un doble propósito. Por una parte, los datos recogidos permitirán a los investigadores avanzar en el conocimiento de los mecanismos de propagación de las enfermedades infecciosas y, por otra, el proyecto constituirá una herramienta de divulgación para acercar la ciencia al ciudadano e involucrarlo directamente en el estudio científico a través de la información facilitada.  

¡Participa tú también y ayúdanos a prevenir la gripe en España!

lom_description: La calidad del café depende de numerosos factores. La calidad depende de la especie vegetal que se utilice (Robusta o Arábica) de la variedad de café sembrada (ver historia del café). Además de los factores genéticos, depende obviamente del árbol y el entorno en que crece. Adicionalmente, la forma como se siembra el café y el adecuado manejo agronómico del cultivo, también influenciará la calidad., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento-NoComercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

Sistema de unidades didácticas de física que utiliza la realidad remota con el objetivo de que los alumnos sean capaces de comprender de una forma más atractiva y precisa los conceptos que están estudiando en clase. El sistema desarrollado es una mezcla de realidad virtual más realidad aumentada: disponemos de un entorno real, al que superponemos elementos virtuales, pero el detalle más novedoso consiste en que tanto el entorno real como los elementos virtuales pueden ser modificados por el usuario del sistema, y todo ello se puede hacer desde un lugar físico distinto, de manera remota., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

wade the stream. Night kneels at your / feet like a gypsy glistening with 
jewels. / You raise your head and the great / mouth yawns. You swallow the 
light./

/(από/ /το//ποίημα//  “Water, Shade”//της// Tracy K 
Smith) /

lom_description: Nella società che sta mutando, lo sviluppo delle scienze e della tecnologia ha cambiato il nostro modo di vivere e di comunicare. Le informazioni che giungono attraverso diversi tipi di canali di comunicazione, impongono che i ragazzi imparino a interpretarle, per essere protagonisti attivi in grado di porsi problemi, comprendere le cause e studiare strategie efficaci di risoluzione, acquisendo consapevolezza delle conseguenze delle proprie scelte. L’utilizzo della robotica educativa consente un apprendimento partecipato e costruito a partire dall’esperienza. I ragazzi acquisiscono competenze attraverso la ricerca, il confronto tra pari, la rielaborazione condivisa, la riflessione sul metodo di lavoro., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., La robotica educativa, cioè la metodologia che prevede un impiego didattico della robotica, si propone di coinvolgere studenti di ogni età, dalla scuola di infanzia alle superiori, nello studio delle materie scientifico tecnologiche in maniera diversa. L’apprendimento avviene emergendo dal lavoro di gruppo, da un nuovo ruolo dell’insegnante (che "scavalca la cattedra" ed entra nel gruppo, guidando la scoperta). Si introduce un nuovo concetto di errore, non più come giudizio negativo, ma come incentivo a fare meglio. La robotica permette di lavorare con strumenti che possono coinvolgere ragazzi anche molto diversi tra loro, per provenienza culturale e linguistica, per età, per stile di apprendimento.Le esperienze di robotica educativa sono estremamente inclusive, i ragazzi più dotati e quelli con difficoltà di apprendimento sono accomunati nella progettazione, nella costruzione, nella programmazione di piccoli robot lavorando in gruppo e mettendo in mostra i propri talenti, le proprie intelligenze diverse, evidenziandole agli occhi dei docenti e dei propri compagni. Il riconoscere l’intelligenza dell’altro anche se diverso è il primo passo per l’integrazione completa di stranieri, portatori di handicap, o studenti “difficili”.I progetti di robotica educativa sono abitualmente usati in Europa anche per migliorare l’apprendimento di genere, consentendo alle ragazze di non allontanarsi dalle materie scientifico-tecnologiche., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description: Slides presentation about Robotica educativa. Nella società che sta mutando, lo sviluppo delle scienze e della tecnologia ha cambiato il nostro modo di vivere e di comunicare. Le informazioni che giungono attraverso diversi tipi di canali di comunicazione, impongono che i ragazzi imparino a interpretarle, per essere protagonisti attivi in grado di porsi problemi, comprendere le cause e studiare strategie efficaci di risoluzione, acquisendo consapevolezza delle conseguenze delle proprie scelte. L’utilizzo della robotica educativa consente un apprendimento partecipato e costruito a partire dall’esperienza. I ragazzi acquisiscono competenze attraverso la ricerca, il confronto tra pari, la rielaborazione condivisa, la riflessione sul metodo di lavoro.

lom_description: El proceso de tueste se dedica íntegramente a producir un café sabroso. Cuando se tuesta, el grano de café verde aumenta su tamaño hasta casi el doble, cambiando en color y densidad. Dado que el grano absorbe calor, el color cambia a amarillo, después a un ligero color marrón, y finalmente a un color oscuro y aceitoso. Durante el tueste aparecen aceites en la superficie del grano. El tueste continuará oscureciendo el café hasta que se elimine de la fuente de calor., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento-NoComercial'. lli_description: Slides presentation about tostadora de cafe. El proceso de tueste se dedica íntegramente a producir un café sabroso. Cuando se tuesta, el grano de café verde aumenta su tamaño hasta casi el doble, cambiando en color y densidad. Dado que el grano absorbe calor, el color cambia a amarillo, después a un ligero color marrón, y finalmente a un color oscuro y aceitoso. Durante el tueste aparecen aceites en la superficie del grano. El tueste continuará oscureciendo el café hasta que se elimine de la fuente de calor.

lom_description: Los tomates hidropónicos se plantan en una solución de nutrientes en lugar del suelo. Por lo general, se colocan en un material sin tierra que pueda soportar sus raíces y retener los nutrientes. Cultivar tomates de forma hidropónica te permite cultivarlos en un ambiente controlado que reduce las posibilidades de que padezcan enfermedades, facilita un crecimiento más rápido y garantiza una mayor producción de frutos. Sin embargo, el cultivo hidropónico requiere mucho más trabajo y, en ocasiones, es más costoso que el cultivo normal de tomates; en especial si nunca antes has implementado un sistema hidropónico., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento-NoComercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

Cultivar tomates de forma hidropónica te permite cultivarlos en un ambiente controlado que reduce las posibilidades de que padezcan enfermedades, facilita un crecimiento más rápido y garantiza una mayor producción de frutos. Sin embargo, el cultivo hidropónico requiere mucho más trabajo y, en ocasiones, es más costoso que el cultivo normal de tomates; en especial si nunca antes has implementado un sistema hidropónico.

lom_description: La lechuga es conocida desde la Antigüedad por sus propiedades relajantes y sedantes, por lo que se la recomienda para el insomnio. Combate la fatiga y la anemia por su alto contenido en hierro, es fuente de antioxidantes, es diurética, regula los niveles de azúcar en sangre y fortalece las vías respiratorias. En definitiva, una fuente de salud a nuestro alcance no solo en el supermercado, sino también en nuestro pequeño huerto urbano., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento-NoComercial'. Combate la fatiga y la anemia por su alto contenido en hierro, es fuente de antioxidantes, es diurética, regula los niveles de azúcar en sangre y fortalece las vías respiratorias. En definitiva, una fuente de salud a nuestro alcance no solo en el supermercado, sino también en nuestro pequeño huerto urbano.

lli_title: Ley de los gases ideales - ViSH
lom_description: En esta ILS se trabaja que el alumno aprenda (o recuerde) las leyes de los gases ideales, pero sobretodo de manera cualitativa. Al final, ha de ser el profesor el que le diga que todo se relaciona con la ley de los gases ideales.También, si se esfuerza un poco más, puede llegar a deducir las constantes que hay entre ellos, aunque nunca llegará a saber que está el número de moles., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. lli_title: Kas on hea olla ilus? 2015 - ViSH
lom_description: Õpid kui tähtis on evolutsiooni mõistmiseks aru saada loodusliku ja sugulise valiku protsessidest. Nende teemade õppimiseks töötad läbi uurimistsükli, mis koosneb viiest uurimisetapist (suunaseadmine; küsimuste ja hüpoteeside püstitamine; uurimine; järeldamine; arutelu). Lisaks bioloogia õppimisele omandad ka teadusliku uurimuse läbiviimiseks vajalikud oskused. Samuti on Sul hea võimalus läbi viia katseid virtuaalses laboris „Suguline valik gupidel" (Sexual Selection in Guppies) ja koguda ning analüüsida andmeid samamoodi nagu bioloog John Endler, kui ta uuris 1970ndatel aastatel esmakordselt gupide loodusliku ja sugulise valiku tasakaalu., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

lom_description: Students will study the motion of a charged particle in a magnetic field, in order to determine the strength of the field of one of the ATLAS magnets, used to measure the momentum of the particles produced by particle collisions at the CERN LHC accelerator. lom_description: In this activity students investigate the different shapes of galaxies and their origin. They observe images taken from telescopes which depict interacting galaxies and in sequence they use the “Galaxy Crash” simulation in order to simulate the creation of these galaxies. In addition, using the simulation, students are given the opportunity to experiment and discover different galactical shapes which they are then asked to classify., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivs'. their origin. They observe images taken from telescopes which depict 
interacting galaxies and in sequence they use the “Galaxy Crash” 
simulation in order to simulate the creation of these galaxies. In addition, 
using the simulation, students are given the opportunity to experiment and 
discover different galactical shapes which they are then asked to classify.

lom_description: schulische Konzepte zur Berufsorientierung
lli_description: schulische Konzepte zur Berufsorientierung

lom_description: The phenomenon of shadow was, from antiquity, well defined as the absence of light. Aristotle, in fact, had argued for a spherical earth believing that the curved lines on the lunar surface produced by the shadow of a spherical earth, which interweaved between the sun and the moon (Grant 2011, p.95). The present didactic proposal, for typical and SEN students, is participation for Open Discovery Space’s (ODS) contest for educational scenario of 2014-15 (Greece). It forms IBSE learning model and emphasis was given to the association of the content with every day life, to peer-to-peer education and to the big ideas of science (Harlen 2010). This didactic proposal is supported by a Teaching Plan and Inquiry Learning Spaces (ILS) in Greek and English. Students, working in groups, initially invited to engage in an exploration of the phenomenon of shadow using interactive whiteboard and the learning object “Shadow (umbra and penumbra)” from photodentro.edu.gr (see here http://goo.gl/iwW0zh). Moreover, the use metamemory questions is aiming at self-regulation of learning through Judgments of Learning (JOLs) and Ease of Learning,(EOLs) judgments (Karably & Zabrucky 2009)., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

earth, which interweaved between the sun and the moon (Grant 2011, p.95). The

lli_title: Investiguem el Virus de la Sida (VIH) - ViSH
lom_description: Aquest ILS permet treballar conceptes entorn al VIH/Sida, així com aspectes ètics, legals i socio-econòmics que giren entorn a aquesta temàtica.En la fase d'investigació i mitjançant diferents laboratoris virtuals, l'alumnat podrà realitzar diferents pràctiques per poder concloure què és millor de cares a trobar una vacuna per la Sida.En la fase de discussió final es tracten temes més ètics i socio-econòmics que es poden tractar més grupalment i generar debat, així cada alumne pot extreure les seves propies conclusions finals pel que fa a aspectes no tant científics i més socials., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Investiguem el Virus de la Sida (VIH). Aquest ILS permet treballar conceptes entorn al VIH/Sida, així com aspectes 
ètics, legals i socio-econòmics que giren entorn a aquesta temàtica.

En la fase d'investigació i mitjançant diferents laboratoris virtuals, 
l'alumnat podrà realitzar diferents pràctiques per poder concloure què és 
millor de cares a trobar una vacuna per la Sida.

En la fase de discussió final es tracten temes més ètics i 
socio-econòmics que es poden tractar més grupalment i generar debat, així 
cada alumne pot extreure les seves propies conclusions finals pel que fa a 
aspectes no tant científics i més socials.

lom_description: Utilizzando un archivio dei terremoti storici più rilevanti gli studenti raccoglieranno informazioni e localizzeranno  sul planisfero i siti in cui si sono verificati, per osservare come si distribuiscono sulla superficie terrestre.Ogni coppia di studenti deve ricercare i terremoti più forti relativamente ad un certo periodo di tempo e compilare una tabella e poi tracciare le posizioni dei terremoti su un planisfero, distinguendo così distinte zone sismiche, al fine di individuare la corrispondenza tra i margini di placca e la distribuzione dei terremoti.Tutto ciò avviene prima di mostrare alla classe il planisfero delle placche tettoniche, al fine di condurre alla scoperta delle stesse grazie alla presente attività., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Investigare sui terremoti. Utilizzando un archivio dei terremoti storici più rilevanti gli studenti 
raccoglieranno informazioni e localizzeranno  sul planisfero i siti in cui 
si sono verificati, per osservare come si distribuiscono sulla superficie 
terrestre.

Ogni coppia di studenti deve ricercare i terremoti più forti relativamente 
ad un certo periodo di tempo e compilare una tabella e poi tracciare le 
posizioni dei terremoti su un planisfero, distinguendo così distinte zone 
sismiche, al fine di individuare la corrispondenza tra i margini di placca e 
la distribuzione dei terremoti.

Tutto ciò avviene prima di mostrare alla classe il planisfero delle placche 
tettoniche, al fine di condurre alla scoperta delle stesse grazie alla 
presente attività.

lom_title: Is Radioactivity always harmful for humans?
lli_title: Is Radioactivity always harmful for humans? - ViSH
lom_description: This Inquiry Learning Space aims at understanding the different types of radioactivity particles and the basics about radioactivity decay. Factors that influence the radioactivity intensity (distance from radioactivity source, exposure time and presence of absorbers) will also be discussed.The Radioactivity Lab examines the intensity of radiation over distance, demonstrating the effects of the inverse square law. Students investigate the intensity of radiation being emitted from a radioactive Strontium-90 source, by setting distances at which a Geiger counter measures radiation, and collecting radioactive particle counts at each of these distances. A table holding the radioactive source is rotated until the source is aligned with a hole in a thick lead plate. The head holding the Geiger-Muller tube is moved to these distances from the radioactive source., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Is Radioactivity always harmful for humans?. This Inquiry Learning Space aims at understanding the different types of 
radioactivity particles and the basics about radioactivity decay. Factors 
that influence the radioactivity intensity (distance from radioactivity 
source, exposure time and presence of absorbers) will also be discussed.
The Radioactivity Lab examines the intensity of radiation over distance, 
demonstrating the effects of the inverse square law. Students investigate the 
intensity of radiation being emitted from a radioactive Strontium-90 source, 
by setting distances at which a Geiger counter measures radiation, and 
collecting radioactive particle counts at each of these distances. A table 
holding the radioactive source is rotated until the source is aligned with a 
hole in a thick lead plate. The head holding the Geiger-Muller tube is moved 
to these distances from the radioactive source.

lom_title: Is it Good to be Beautiful - Understanding Evolution through Natural and Sexual Selection
lli_title: Is it Good to be Beautiful - Understanding Evolution through Natural and Sexual Selection - ViSH
lom_description: This inquiry activity teaches students about the importance of natural and sexual selection processes in understanding evolution. It allows students to conduct scientific experiments using the online laboratory /Sexual Selection in Guppies /and collect & analyze data just like the biologist John Endler did when he first investigated the balance of natural and sexual selection in guppy fish in the 1970s. Students work through an inquiry cycle model and acquire scientific investigative skills that actual biologists and other scientists apply when making discoveries and investigating new phenomena., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:

sexual selection processes in understanding evolution. It allows students to

did when he first investigated the balance of natural and sexual selection in

lom_description: Informationen zur Schulform, gebündelt verfügbar
lli_description:
Die Gymnasien in Niedersachsen leisten wesentliche Beiträge zur laufenden Schulreform. Die neu entstehenden Arbeitsgrundlagen werden über diese Seiten gebündelt.

Die Entwicklung des Unterrichts u.a. in den Bereichen Darstellendes Spiel und einem mathematisch-naturwissenschaftlich-technischen Schwerpunkt werden seitens des NiLS durch unterschiedliche Qualifizierungsangebote und besondere Projekte in Zusammenarbeit mit außerschulischen Anbietern wie Universitäten oder wirtschaftsnahen Organisationen unterstützt:

lom_description: This Inquiry Learning Space is designed for young Chemistry students of lower secondary school (12-15 years old) and aims at introducing the pH concept and scale.It is based on a pHET simulation which is simple to use and involves the characterisation of familiar solutions into acids or bases. Furthermore, it studies the effect of volume and dilution to the pH of a solution.The benefit of conducting this lab virtually is that students can test liquids that are normally difficult to test in “real” labs, such as vomit and blood. It is also easy and quick to use and overcomes practical problems such as pH-meter calibration, need of multiple instruments and resources, lack of time and other educational difficulties, whilst at the same time offering a fun and informative introduction to the pH scale. During this activity the students are able to conduct three different experiments:/Experiment 1: pH measurement the pH of 11 familiar liquids and classification into acids or bases/In this experiment students “test” the pH of 11 different liquids from their everyday life, such as blood, spit, soda pop, battery acid and water, though the use of an electronic pH-meter, which they are supposed to classify into acids or bases. Through this activity they are also included to neutral solutions./Experiment 2: Influence of volume to the pH./In this phase the students test whether volume has an effect on a liquid’s pH./Experiment 3: Influence of dilution to the pH./In this experiment students test whether dilution (the addition of water) affects a liquid’s pH and note the difference between an acid and a base, as in both cases the pH approaches 7 (in the case of an acid in increases, whilst in the case of a base it decreases).Throughout the activity the students are required to answer a number of questions that require critical thinking and link the concept of pH to real life (e.g. why does drinking soda pop help soothe a tummy ache)., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about pH scale ILS. This Inquiry Learning Space is designed for young Chemistry students of lower 
secondary school (12-15 years old) and aims at introducing the pH concept and 
scale.

It is based on a pHET simulation which is simple to use and involves the 
characterisation of familiar solutions into acids or bases. Furthermore, it 
studies the effect of volume and dilution to the pH of a solution.

The benefit of conducting this lab virtually is that students can test 
liquids that are normally difficult to test in “real” labs, such as vomit 
and blood. It is also easy and quick to use and overcomes practical problems 
such as pH-meter calibration, need of multiple instruments and resources, 
lack of time and other educational difficulties, whilst at the same time 
offering a fun and informative introduction to the pH scale. 

During this activity the students are able to conduct three different 
experiments:

/Experiment 1: pH measurement the pH of 11 familiar liquids and 
classification into acids or bases/

In this experiment students “test” the pH of 11 different liquids from 
their everyday life, such as blood, spit, soda pop, battery acid and water, 
though the use of an electronic pH-meter, which they are supposed to classify 
into acids or bases. Through this activity they are also included to neutral 
solutions.

/Experiment 2: Influence of volume to the pH./

In this phase the students test whether volume has an effect on a liquid’s 
pH.

/Experiment 3: Influence of dilution to the pH./

In this experiment students test whether dilution (the addition of water) 
affects a liquid’s pH and note the difference between an acid and a base, 
as in both cases the pH approaches 7 (in the case of an acid in increases, 
whilst in the case of a base it decreases).

Throughout the activity the students are required to answer a number of 
questions that require critical thinking and link the concept of pH to real 
life (e.g. why does drinking soda pop help soothe a tummy ache).

lli_title: Planeta MARTE-un proiect pentru umanitate - ViSH
lom_description: Deşi niciun astronaut nu a păşit încă pe Marte, oamenii de ştiinţă se pregătesc deja pentru ziua în care pământenii vor ajunge pe planeta roşie. Lecţia propusă este utilă pentru descoperirea diferitelor caracteristici ale sistemului solar, /*în special a planetei Marte*/, folosind /*aplicația WorldWide Telescope*/ [1] ce ne transpune  într-o realitate virtuală în care putem explora lucruri noi referitoare la tematica abordată. Datorită complexității subiectului propus, planul de lecţie poate fi folosit inter și/sau transdisciplinar –/* astronomie, geografie, fizică, biologie, istorie etc.*/, motivarea elevilor și atitudinea pozitivă reprezentând punctul de plecare al acestui demers didactic. Pornind de la conţinutul ştiinţific şi folosind aplicaţiile propuse, elevii vor fi implicaţi individual sau pe echipe în activităţi de colaborare, comunicare, creaţie care se vor materializa în realizarea mai multor materiale digitale transdisciplinare cu implicare în viaţa reală. [1] http://www.golabz.eu/lab/worldwide-telescope, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. lli_title: O Coelhinho da Seleção Natural - ViSH
lom_description: A teoria da Selecção Natural apresentada em 1859 no livro "A origem das espécies" escrito por Charles Darwin é uma das teorias fundamentais da Biologia. Nesta atividade o aluno é conduzido, através de três experiências em que são simuladas diferentes condições de seleção, a testar hipóteses sobre evolução segundo os mecanismos de seleção natural. Pretende-se que o aluno confronte as suas concepções prévias sobre evolução integrando os conceitos fundamentais do mecanismo de evolução por selecção natural., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. lom_description: This ILS is based on the learning materials developed by Lisette van Rens of the VU Amsterdam. Adapted by Henny Leemkuil, (Department of Instructional Technology, University of Twente). In this ILS students will: * Gain knowledge about the chemistry of acids and bases and on the process   of diazotation. * Gain knowledge on the production of methyl orange in a micro reactor. * Judge the accuracy and reliability of research. * Design a 'fair' inquiry, measure accurately, determine whether   measurements are reliable and lead to valid conclusions. * Be part of a simulated research community and gain knowledge on peer   discussion.Pre university students will use a remote lab with real equipment. They can operate the micro reactor from their own computer and can see what they are doing by means of webcams that are situated around the micro reactor. Students have to make a reservation to use the lab for 50 minutes. The ILS will take several lessons and involves homework. Warning! To run the Methyl Orange experiment you need additional plugins for Java [1] and Silverlight [2]. [1] http://www.java.com/en/download/index.jsp[2] http://www.microsoft.com/silverlight/, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Methyl orange. This ILS is based on the learning materials developed by Lisette van Rens of 
the VU Amsterdam. Adapted by Henny Leemkuil, (Department of Instructional 
Technology, University of Twente). In this ILS students will:

 * Gain knowledge about the chemistry of acids and bases and on the process
   of diazotation.
 * Gain knowledge on the production of methyl orange in a micro reactor.
 * Judge the accuracy and reliability of research.
 * Design a 'fair' inquiry, measure accurately, determine whether
   measurements are reliable and lead to valid conclusions.
 * Be part of a simulated research community and gain knowledge on peer
   discussion.

Pre university students will use a remote lab with real equipment. They can 
operate the micro reactor from their own computer and can see what they are 
doing by means of webcams that are situated around the micro reactor. 
Students have to make a reservation to use the lab for 50 minutes. The ILS 
will take several lessons and involves homework. Warning! To run the Methyl 
Orange experiment you need additional plugins for Java [1] and Silverlight 
[2].

 


[1] http://www.java.com/en/download/index.jsp
[2] http://www.microsoft.com/silverlight/

lom_description: The Sun is a yellow dwarf star at the centre of our Solar System. It is 4.5 billion years old and has converted about half of the hydrogen in its core into helium. The Sun is the most popular star. It gives life for the whole universe. It has prodigiously energy. As everyone knows the sun grows rapidly. That means, the amount of his energy is growing as well. So if you install a photovoltaic module now, it will produce more energy every year. This is the one and only confident chance to get unbelievably rich within at least 10 years. You will multiply your gains every year. You would be a fool, if you don't use this unbelievably good chance., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Reconocimiento'. lli_title: Splash - experimenting in thermal pools - ViSH
lom_description: This ILS is designed to be used to make virtual experiments online, based on data collected from thermal swimming pools in a real setting. For example, users of this ILS could observe buoyancy in serveral thermal bath pools of different temperature with different minerals. development.

Future widespread use of renewable energies, in particular solar energy is a 
planetary priority that should not be ignored by anyone.

lom_description: In this ILS students can learn about properties of objects that influence whether an object sinks or floats in the water. They get the assignment to find out which materials they can use to build a raft that floats in order to leave the island they are currently on. lom_description: Online- Materialien

The resistance of an electrical conductor depends on several factors. Its physical shape is one factor. The type of conductor material is another, as might be expected. That is, two conductors with the same physical shape, but of different materials, have different resistances. This important material characteristic of resistance is expressed in terms of a quantity called resistivity.The ILS shows you how you can do resistance and resitivity measurements in the lab and you will understad how would change the resistance of a wire conductor If the length were to double or the Area were to double., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Resistance and Resistivity measurements. The resistance of an electrical conductor depends on several factors. Its 
physical shape is one factor. The type of conductor material is another, as 
might be expected. That is, two conductors with the same physical shape, but 
of different materials, have different resistances. This important material 
characteristic of resistance is expressed in terms of a quantity called 
resistivity.

The ILS shows you how you can do resistance and resitivity measurements in 
the lab and you will understad how would change the resistance of a wire 
conductor If the length were to double or the Area were to double.

lom_description: One of the most important concerns of the energy policy is solar energy systems education and promoting solar energy applications for sustainable development. The photovoltaic panel converts solar energy to electricity and represents the main element of a photovoltaic system. Studying the characteristic curve of a panel is essential in the study of photovoltaics since it provides important details about the electrical characteristics of the panel and it is used for simulation, design, and performance analysis of photovoltaic systems.Thus, the assessment of the effectiveness of a photovoltaic module requires knowledge of its characteristic curve., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Remote Photovoltaic Lab. One of the most important concerns of the energy policy is solar energy 
systems education and promoting solar energy applications for sustainable 
development. The photovoltaic panel converts solar energy to electricity and 
represents the main element of a photovoltaic system. Studying the 
characteristic curve of a panel is essential in the study of photovoltaics 
since it provides important details about the electrical characteristics of 
the panel and it is used for simulation, design, and performance analysis of 
photovoltaic systems.

Thus, the assessment of the effectiveness of a photovoltaic module requires 
knowledge of its characteristic curve.

lom_description: Dieses  Comenius 3- Projekt ist ein Netzwerkprojekt. Teilnehmer aus den Ländern Niederlande, Großbritannien, Ungarn, Schweden, Frankreich, Türkei und Deutschland wollen über 3 Jahre zusammenarbeiten, um die Integration von Migrantinnen und Migranten an den Schulen, also von Schülerinnen und Schülern mit anderer Herkunftssprache oder aus anderen Herkunftsländern durch die Beteiligung an internationalen Projekten zu fördern.

lli_description:
Presentación enriquecida (y gratis) sobre El valor de palabra. Si algo es clave en el mundo digital , es el valor de la palabra, el único nexo que puede hacer y producir la magia del cambio en otro ser humano. Detrás de cualquier "aparatejo de litio" siempre hay un ser humano.

Trabajar la magia de las palabras con nuestros alumnos es clave para ayudarles a reflexionar sobre la repercusión de lo que uno escribe y leen miles.

lli_title: The origins of Cinema. - Papandreou Christos
lom_description:
The purpose of this excursion is to make students understand the basic principles of animation and cinema. Through their predecessors, various optical toys, they will understand how  we reached at today's modern cinema. Amusing activities and constructions will make them enter into the spirit and sense of animation., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., After this excursion students will:

Learn the origins of animation and cinema.
Familiarize with old optical toys such as thaumatrope, zoetrope, flip-books etc.
Understand the optical phenomenon of retinal persistence as a basic principle of making animated pictures.
Try to construct their own optical toys and develop short animated stories., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

lom_title: Stars Wars. Episodio I: LA AMENAZA FANTASMA.
lli_title: Stars Wars. Episodio I: LA AMENAZA FANTASMA. - Grupo investigación IES David Buján
lom_description: Esta es una película de ciencia ficción llena de efectos especiales que innovaron el cine de aquellos años y sorprendio a todo al que la fue a ver por primera vez. En ella ademas de sorprendentes efectos especiales, se describe la Galaxia desde el punto de vista de la mente creadora de esta película,concretamente nos habla de un pequeño planeta llamado Naboo, el cual obviamente no existe, en el  se centran practicamente todos los acontecimientos que suceden a lo largo de la película.Esta nos cuenta que  la República Galáctica está sumida en el caos. Los impuestos de las rutas comerciales a los sistemas estelares exteriores están en disputa. Por otro lado esperando resolver el asunto con un bloqueo de poderosas naves de guerra, la codiciosa Federación de Comercio ha detenido todos los envíos al pequeño planeta de Naboo.Para resolver este problema  el Canciller Supremo del Congreso de la Repúblicaha enviado en secreto a dos Caballeros Jedi, guardianes de la paz y la justicia en la galaxia., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Stars Wars. Episodio I: LA AMENAZA FANTASMA.. Esta es una película de ciencia ficción llena de efectos especiales que innovaron el cine de aquellos años y sorprendio a todo al que la fue a ver por primera vez. En ella ademas de sorprendentes efectos especiales, se describe la Galaxia desde el punto de vista de la mente creadora de esta película,concretamente nos habla de un pequeño planeta llamado Naboo, el cual obviamente no existe, en el  se centran practicamente todos los acontecimientos que suceden a lo largo de la película.
Esta nos cuenta que  la República Galáctica está sumida en el caos. Los impuestos de las rutas comerciales a los sistemas estelares exteriores están en disputa. Por otro lado esperando resolver el asunto con un bloqueo de poderosas naves de guerra, la codiciosa Federación de Comercio ha detenido todos los envíos al pequeño planeta de Naboo.
Para resolver este problema  el Canciller Supremo del Congreso de la República
ha enviado en secreto a dos Caballeros Jedi, guardianes de la paz y la justicia en la galaxia.

lom_description: Es un arbusto grande, o pequeño árbol de hasta 6-15 m de altura, con hojas de 4-6 cm de largo, bordes aserrados, ápices agudos y salvo el nervio central en el envés.Es uno de los primeros árboles europeos en florecer en primavera; flores blancas o rosas, 1,5-2 cm, con cinco pétalos. Su fruto es una drupa de 2-3 cm de diámetro, amarilla o roja, comestible, alcanzando la madurez a principios del otoño., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lli_description:
Slides presentation about PRUNUS (falso ciruelo). Es un arbusto grande, o pequeño árbol de hasta 6-15 m de altura, con hojas de 4-6 cm de largo, bordes aserrados, ápices agudos y salvo el nervio central en el envés.

Es uno de los primeros árboles europeos en florecer en primavera; flores blancas o rosas, 1,5-2 cm, con cinco pétalos. Su fruto es una drupa de 2-3 cm de diámetro, amarilla o roja, comestible, alcanzando la madurez a principios del otoño.
