lom_title: La búsqueda y organización de la información
lli_title: La búsqueda y organización de la información - celes arteta
lom_description: Al plantearse la escritura de un texto una de las primeras decisiones tienen que ver con el contenido temático del mismo. ¿Qué sé sobre este tema? ¿Qué no sé? ¿Qué necesito buscar? ¿Dónde lo puedo encontrar?El desarrollo y generalización del uso de la red ha provocado cambios fundamentales en el acceso a la información. Hoy en día el problema no es como antiguamente encontrar la información que sólo estaba al alcance de unos pocos, sino gestionarla, saber cómo guardarla, clasificarla... para poder reutilizarla., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lom_description: With this ILS you can to learn about the electromagnetism:-Electromagnet and power.-Weight and electromagnetism.Metodology of use:This ILS is designed to be use by teacers on classroom with the colaboration of students by groups.Age:10-14 years old.You can use "Electromagnet Crane" laboratory as tool:Use the position buttons to move the crane and the power slider to activate the electromagnet to pick up the sample little balls weights and deduce their weights using the relation voltage/weight chart., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. -Electromagnet and power.

-Weight and electromagnetism.

Metodology of use:This ILS is designed to be use by teacers on classroom with 
the colaboration of students by groups.Age:10-14 years old.

You can use "Electromagnet Crane" laboratory as tool:

Use the position buttons to move the crane and the power slider to activate 
the electromagnet to pick up the sample little balls weights and deduce their 
weights using the relation voltage/weight chart.

lom_description: This inquiry space introduces the student in analog circuit design using a virtual lab; specifically the use of one-way switches and two-way switches to solve three technological problems. With this purpose, the students will first review some basic concepts (parallel/series, current/voltage, etc.) and write some hypotheses. Finally, the students are asked to work in groups to show their finding with short presentation., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. lom_description: El Olivo es un que puede alcanzar hasta los 10 metros de altura.Sus hojas son perennes, con forma lanceolada, que pueden medir de 2 a 8 cm de longitud; el haz de éstas es verde-grisáceo mientras que el envés es de color plateado. Las flores son hermafroditas, muy pequeñas que forman numerosos racimos. El fruto es la aceituna, de cuyo zumo se obtiene el aceite.Los olivos se hallan amplia mente cultivados en toda el área Mediterránea, sobre todo en el sur de la Península Ibérica., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about El Olivo. El Olivo es un que puede alcanzar hasta los 10 metros de altura.
Sus hojas son perennes, con forma lanceolada, que pueden medir de 2 a 8 cm de longitud; el haz de éstas es verde-grisáceo mientras que el envés es de color plateado.
 Las flores son hermafroditas, muy pequeñas que forman numerosos racimos. 
El fruto es la aceituna, de cuyo zumo se obtiene el aceite.
Los olivos se hallan amplia mente cultivados en toda el área Mediterránea, sobre todo en el sur de la Península Ibérica.

lom_description: This excursion is about the Iberian Lynx, one of the most endangered cat species in the world. Lynx have a short tail and characteristic tufts of black hair on the tips of their ears; large, padded paws for walking on snow; and long whiskers on the face. Under their neck, they have a ruff which has black bars, is not very visible, and resembles a bow tie., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Learn about the Iberian Lynx., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lom_description: El término espada ropera tiene su origen en España durante el siglo XV y hace referencia al tipo de espadas que solían portar los hombres cuando iban vestidos con ropa de civiles. Así pues, la espada ropera conformaba una pieza más de la vestimenta y a su vez podía emplearse como arma tanto ofensiva como defensiva. , This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lli_description: Slides presentation about La Espada Ropera. El término espada ropera tiene su origen en España durante el siglo XV y hace referencia al tipo de espadas que solían portar los hombres cuando iban vestidos con ropa de civiles. Así pues, la espada ropera conformaba una pieza más de la vestimenta y a su vez podía emplearse como arma tanto ofensiva como defensiva.

lom_description: 3D Fractal Lab WebGL A fractal is a mathematical set that typically displays self-similar patterns, which means it is "the same from near as from far". lli_title: Plan Actividades Grupo Proyectos Europeos - Jose Viñas
lom_description: El Grupo de Proyectos Europeos del IES David Buján tiene planeado desarrollar el siguiente Plan de Actividades durante el Curso 2013-2014, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., O Grupo dede Proxectos Europeos, pretende favorecer o contacto das familias e o resto da comunidade educativa, cos alumnos participantes na actividade a levar a cabo nese momento.Ao longo destes anos, pretendemos visitar diferentes paises, coñecer distintas culturas, non como meros turistas, senón como invitados. O vivir durante unha, duas ou tres semanas nos fogares de cada un dos nosos "partners", empaparannos, sen querer, dos seus costumes, tradición ou idioma. A visita dos nosos invitados, ao centro, provocará, sen dúbida, un efecto similar. Creemos que o mellor xeito de "facer do mundo a nosa casa" é coñecendo e respectando as súas culturas., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description: Slides presentation about Plan Actividades Grupo Proyectos Europeos. El Grupo de Proyectos Europeos del IES David Buján tiene planeado desarrollar el siguiente Plan de Actividades durante el Curso 2013-2014

All members of the team must work together – but individuals could be doing very different jobs.

 It is just like this in our own bodies!

lom_description: Citizen Science refers to the general public engagement in scientific research where citizens actively contribute to science either with their intellectual effort or surrounding knowledge, or with their tools or resources. Through ICT-based research methods, collaboration models and openness, new learning escenarios are possible. This Excursion presents the concepts, contexts and impacts of the Citizen Science in general, showing concrete experiments and didactical materials developed by the BIFI and Ibercivis. Let's engage!, This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., This Excursion presents the concepts, contexts and impacts of the Citizen Science in general, showing concrete experiments and didactical materials developed by the BIFI and Ibercivis. , License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. lli_description:
Slides presentation about Citizen Science at schools. Citizen Science refers to the general public engagement in scientific research where citizens actively contribute to science either with their intellectual effort or surrounding knowledge, or with their tools or resources. 

Through ICT-based research methods, collaboration models and openness, new learning escenarios are possible. 

This Excursion presents the concepts, contexts and impacts of the Citizen Science in general, showing concrete experiments and didactical materials developed by the BIFI and Ibercivis. 

Let's engage!

lom_description: La inteligencia interpersonal, la que se emplea para relacionarse con otras personas, percibir estados de ánimo, emociones y comunicarse, se aborda aquí mediante una colección de animaciones que ilustran diferentes situaciones en las que se emplea el lenguaje no verbal para comunicarse con los demás., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., La inteligencia interpersonal no parece depender del lenguaje  verbal.En esta excursión se invita al uso de la propia capacidad para detectar lo que quieren o no quieren expresar las personas a través de su lenguaje corporal.Esta capacidad se da en forma altamente sofisticada en los líderes religiosos y políticos, en los maestros y profesores, en los terapeutas y en los padres.Está relacionada con dos factores peculiares de la especie humana. Uno, la prolongada duración de la infancia en los primates, incluyendo la estrecha relación con la madre. Cuando se sufre una pérdida en esta etapa el desarrollo interpersonal corre serio peligro. Otro factor es la importancia de la relación social para los humanos. Cazar o rastrear era una actividad de las sociedades prehistóricas que requerían la participación y cooperación de una gran cantidad de gente. La necesidad de cohesión en el grupo, de liderazgo, de organización y de solidaridad surge de forma natural. Referencias:Inteligencias múltiples. Howar Gardner.The human animal. Desmond MorrisEl lenguaje no verbal. Alan Pease, License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description: Slides presentation about Sobran las palabras. La inteligencia interpersonal, la que se emplea para relacionarse con otras personas, percibir estados de ánimo, emociones y comunicarse, se aborda aquí mediante una colección de animaciones que ilustran diferentes situaciones en las que se emplea el lenguaje no verbal para comunicarse con los demás.

lom_title: Forest Fires. Planet Earth is calling...S.O.S.
lli_title: Forest Fires. Planet Earth is calling...S.O.S. - Papandreou Christos
lom_description: During August 2007our prefecture, Ilia, faced the most horrific fire in our history. Moscow fires,during summer 2010, caused similar disaster. So there is a need for a common approach in terms of Environmental Educationworldwide.The aim of this excursion is to make people think about environment more seriously.Important note: All the material is original (booklets, experiment videos, earth's message, drawings) and were produced by our pupils and the teacher during our project about plants., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Important note: All the material is original (booklets, experiment videos, earth's message, drawings) and were produced by our pupils and the teacher during our project about plants.After our activities, pupils will:    Understand through experiment the way roots support the plants.    Understand through experiment soil’s additional and auxiliary role on plant’s support and the interactive relation between roots and soil.    Conclude and rate from the above, forest’s importance on soil’s support and protection from flood.    Acquire awareness of the danger our planet is going through and realize that every living object deserves our respect and protection.    Learn to work in groups and understand that team work is more effective as they develop communication skills and sociability.    Improve their I.C.T. skills and performance., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Forest Fires. Planet Earth is calling...S.O.S.. During August 2007our prefecture, Ilia, faced the most horrific fire in our history. Moscow fires,during summer 2010, caused similar disaster. So there is a need for a common approach in terms of Environmental Education
worldwide.
The aim of this excursion is to make people think about environment more seriously.

Important note: All the material is original (booklets, experiment videos, earth's message, drawings) and were produced by our pupils and the teacher during our project about plants.

lli_title: FOOD SAFETY AND FOOD DEFENS - FRANCISCO GONZÁLEZ
lom_description: La seguridad alimentaria es un requisito indispensable en nuestro sistema sanitario nacional. Para lograr alcanzar los mayores estándares de calidad alimentaria e inocuidad de los alimentos es preciso implantar sistemas de control y trazabilidad en todos los procesos llevados a cabo por la industria alimentara. Al mismo tiempo, las tendencias globales de exportación de nuevos alimentos a países como Estados Unidos han traído consigo la necesidad de coordinar de forma globalizada procedimientos que eviten el uso de los alimentos como armas contra la sociedad. En este sentido, ambos conceptos, food safety y food defens, se complementa, evitando tanto los riesgo fortuitos como los intencionados, y aseguran la inocuidad de los alimentos a escala global., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about FOOD SAFETY AND FOOD DEFENS. La seguridad alimentaria es un requisito indispensable en nuestro sistema sanitario nacional. Para lograr alcanzar los mayores estándares de calidad alimentaria e inocuidad de los alimentos es preciso implantar sistemas de control y trazabilidad en todos los procesos llevados a cabo por la industria alimentara. 

Al mismo tiempo, las tendencias globales de exportación de nuevos alimentos a países como Estados Unidos han traído consigo la necesidad de coordinar de forma globalizada procedimientos que eviten el uso de los alimentos como armas contra la sociedad. 

En este sentido, ambos conceptos, food safety y food defens, se complementa, evitando tanto los riesgo fortuitos como los intencionados, y aseguran la inocuidad de los alimentos a escala global.

For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use ., Eso es lo que pasa cuando uno no hace bien las cuentas y no tiene en cuenta el signo al aplicar las raices cuadradas. Cualquiera que haya estudiado ecuaciones con radicales se daría cuenta.Ez az, mi történik, ha nem csinál jól az elszámolás és figyelmen kívül hagyja a jel alkalmazása során a négyzetgyöke. Bárki, aki tanult egyenletek gyökökkel venné észre., For us, it's self-evident, but for the students not always.Please, write in english, because the translator program not always translates of what you thought, and unfortunately, I don't speak Spanish.

lli_title: Identificación de Minerales - 2º ESO IES David Buján
lom_description: Identificaremos minerales en el laboratorio gracias a códigos QR.Hemos escogido los minerales más habituales y así, cada profesor podrá adaptar nuestra idea a su laboratorio., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., El estudio de los minerales suele ser un tema árido para los alumnos de los cursos inferiores. Por ello, los alumnos de Geología de 2º de bachillerato, intentamos transmitir el interés que nosotros mismos tenemos, a través de esta actividad lectiva al tiempo que sencilla.OBJETIVOS:- Intentar que los alumnos adquieran, de forma divertida, conocimientos sobre los minerales de nuestro laboratorio de geología.- Incrementar la competencia científica. Identificaremos minerales atendiendo a sus propiedades físicas y químicas, siguiendo el guión de prácticas de ViSH en el móvil al tiempo que nos sirve como  guía de minerales, con indicación de las características generales y localización geográfica.- Incrementar la competencia digital. Utilización de códigos QR, uso de móviles o tablets, manejo de la plataforma ViSH en el aula.Nota.- Hemos adaptado los tamaños de letra y las características de escritura a un visionado sencillo desde nuestro móvil., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use ., Buenísima excursión, empezaré en 1º de ESO con minerales, la utilizaré.Dejo además mi enhorabuena por la excursión del mes, Si imprimes los códigos QR de los minerales para poder pegarlos a las cajas de minerales. Si haces una búsqueda de un mineral, te debería salir la imagen del mineral, el código QR y la e-excursion. Gracias Marisa!!, Great job. Good practise to adopt to other subjcts distiguishing.Thanks for inspitation. From 3rd Summer school in Split conference.
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Identificación de Minerales. Identificaremos minerales en el laboratorio gracias a códigos QR.
Hemos escogido los minerales más habituales y así, cada profesor podrá adaptar nuestra idea a su laboratorio.

lom_description: An effective K-12 science education is essential to succeed in future phases of the curriculum and the e-Infrastructures for education provide new opportunities to enhance it. This paper presents ViSH Viewer, an innovative web tool to consume educational content which aims to facilitate e-Science infrastructures access through a next generation learning object called “Virtual Excursion”. Virtual Excursions provide a new way to explore science in class by taking advantage of e-Infrastructure resources and their integration with other educational contents, resulting in the creation of a reusable, interoperable and granular learning object. In order to better understand how this tool can allow teachers and students a joyful exploration of e-Science, we also present three Virtual Excursion examples. Details about the design, development and the tool itself are explained in this paper as well as the concept, structure and metadata of the new learning object., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., Present VISH Viewer, an innovative HTML5 web application, License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

Virtual Excursions provide a new way to explore science in class by taking advantage of e-Infrastructure resources and their integration with other educational contents, resulting in the creation of a reusable, interoperable and granular learning object. In order to better understand how this tool can allow teachers and students a joyful exploration of e-Science, we also present three Virtual Excursion examples. Details about the design, development and the tool itself are explained in this paper as well as the concept, structure and metadata of the new learning object.

lom_title: Euglena: A Remote Online Microbiology Lab
lli_title: Euglena: A Remote Online Microbiology Lab - ViSH
lom_description: Welcome! This is a lab inquiry space for the Euglena laboratory. This learning space was designed primarily for 12-14 year old students.In this remote lab, students can test the effects of light on the photosynthetic single-celled organism /Euglena gracilis/. The lab is located at Stanford University and houses a real /E. gracilis /population inside a microfluidic chamber that is placed under the microscope. On each side of the microfluidic chamber is an LED light; the brightness of these lights can be controlled with a virtual "joystick" and hence the response (or lack of response) of the /E. gracilis/ to light can be tested.Please note: we are still in the beta phase for the lab, so it may be down at some times. , This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

learning space was designed primarily for 12-14 year old students.

In this remote lab, students can test the effects of light on the 
photosynthetic single-celled organism /Euglena gracilis/. The lab is located

microfluidic chamber is an LED light; the brightness of these lights can be 
controlled with a virtual "joystick" and hence the response (or lack of 
response) of the /E. gracilis/ to light can be tested.

Please note: we are still in the beta phase for the lab, so it may be down at 
some times.

lom_description: En este ILS el alumno investiga de qué  variables depende la f.e.m de una pila  y cómo depende de ellas. Sigue las fases propias del método científico y una vez ha formulado las hipótesis, utiliza  un laboratorio virtual para contrastarlas y sacar las conclusiones correspondientes.Our objective is to study the variation of cell potential with change in the concentration of electrolytes  at room temperature. Students understand the terms, electrochemical cell, electrolytic cell, Daniell cell, salt bridge, EMF. Students acquire the skill to construct a Daniell cell. Students understand the significance of salt bridge. Students acquire the skill to calculate the electrode potential of a half cell and full cell using the Nernst equation. Students acquire the skill to measure the EMF of a cell by viewing animation & simulator. Students understand how the electrode potential of a given cell varies with the concentration of electrolytes in the anodic and cathodic half cell.  , This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .

pila  y cómo depende de ellas. Sigue las fases propias del método 
científico y una vez ha formulado las hipótesis, utiliza  un laboratorio 
virtual para contrastarlas y sacar las conclusiones correspondientes.

Our objective is to study the variation of cell potential with change in the 
concentration of electrolytes  at room temperature. Students understand the 
terms, electrochemical cell, electrolytic cell, Daniell cell, salt bridge, 
EMF. Students acquire the skill to construct a Daniell cell. Students 
understand the significance of salt bridge. Students acquire the skill to 
calculate the electrode potential of a half cell and full cell using the 
Nernst equation. Students acquire the skill to measure the EMF of a cell by 
viewing animation & simulator. Students understand how the electrode 
potential of a given cell varies with the concentration of electrolytes in 
the anodic and cathodic half cell.

lom_description: Do you know how to use this Go-Lab Portal to explore the online labs and create your own inquiry learning spaces? We have created an inquiry space with instructional videos to show how the Go-Lab portal works! We recommend our users strongly to start with this tutorial to gain an insight of the portal. Try it right now!If you want to integrate other tutorials related to this topic, we recommend you that you sign up in Graasp. After that, you could copy this inquiry space to create your own inquiry space by clicking the button under the image. As an overview: This space introduces the scope and functionality of the Go-Lab platforms for inquiry learning. Golabz focuses on providing the necessary resources for teachers for inquiry activities fostering sharing and reuse of these resources. lom_title: HIGGS PARTICLE: Something very small that makes all the difference
lli_title: HIGGS PARTICLE: Something very small that makes all the difference - Andreas Valadakis
lom_description: A brief history of Higgs particle discovery through ideas and experiments: An excursion from the origin of the Universe to the Large Hadron Collider at CERN., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., To see how reality suggests ideas about the origin of the Universe and how these ideas are checked by experiments., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use ., I do not like criticizing other people's work, but there are three main problems with your presentation: 1. The Higgs boson is not the solution of how all the elementary particles get masses, you can do that without the Higgs for all the particles except for the W and Z bosons. 2. The question "what did it make the difference?" is more related with "why the masses of the elementary particles are so different?", which is a question that the Higgs mechanism cannot answer. And 3. In page 17 you are forgetting A. Migdal and A. Polyakov, which also gave an explanation for that more or less at the same time as these other people, but it was forgotten because of the Iron Curtain., This presentation is only a first approximation to Higgs particle. Sure there are much more details., Nice resource, Very good
lli_description: Slides presentation about HIGGS PARTICLE: Something very small that makes all the difference. A brief history of Higgs particle discovery through ideas and experiments: An excursion from the origin of the Universe to the Large Hadron Collider at CERN.

lom_title: How are the light fixtures in a house connected?
lli_title: How are the light fixtures in a house connected? - ViSH
lom_description: The basic idea of the lesson is to familiarize the students with the elements that compose a simple electric circuit (as well as electric circuits in general) and to introduce them to both parallel and in series circuit setups. After that they formulate their hypotheses and conduct scientific investigations in order to compare the electric current flowing through each light bulb between two setups (in series and parallel) and with the brightness of the bulb of a simple circuit. They will also compare the electric current flowing through each light bulb in two setups with the electric current flowing through the simple electric circuit and understand what happens to the electric current when they add more light bulbs. Then, they will investigate what happens to the light bulbs in each setup if a bulb blows out. Then, they will form conclusions based on the evidence collected and decide the setup that light bulbs in a house are connected., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about How are the light fixtures in a house connected?. The basic idea of the lesson is to familiarize the students with the elements 
that compose a simple electric circuit (as well as electric circuits in 
general) and to introduce them to both parallel and in series circuit setups. 
After that they formulate their hypotheses and conduct scientific 
investigations in order to compare the electric current flowing through each 
light bulb between two setups (in series and parallel) and with the 
brightness of the bulb of a simple circuit. They will also compare the 
electric current flowing through each light bulb in two setups with the 
electric current flowing through the simple electric circuit and understand 
what happens to the electric current when they add more light bulbs. Then, 
they will investigate what happens to the light bulbs in each setup if a bulb 
blows out. Then, they will form conclusions based on the evidence collected 
and decide the setup that light bulbs in a house are connected.

lom_title: Earth's magnetic field: cutting edge research in its past, present and future
lli_title: Earth's magnetic field: cutting edge research in its past, present and future - Caroline Neuberg
lom_description: Interactive movie aimed at your students, age 10 to 14.Cutting edge research in this domain is introduced, focusing on the change of the magnetic field in the past and the future.In this movie, you will learn about the impact of the Earth's magnetic field on our daily life, the change in the magnetic field over the years and millions of years, and the description of what happens during a pole reversal., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., This video presents three cutting edge research videos, carried out by Prof A. Jackson and Prof D. Gubbins, on the evolution of the magnetic field through time, firstly in the past using ship logs data and in the future, looking at how this field could change during a pole reversal event. This video also presents the shape of the magnetic dipole as we go deeper towards the Earth's core. The oversimplified dipole evolves into a rather complex quadrupole structure. , License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:
Slides presentation about Earth's magnetic field: cutting edge research in its past, present and future. Interactive movie aimed at your students, age 10 to 14.
Cutting edge research in this domain is introduced, focusing on the change of the magnetic field in the past and the future.
In this movie, you will learn about the impact of the Earth's magnetic field on our daily life, the change in the magnetic field over the years and millions of years, and the description of what happens during a pole reversal.

lom_description: This activity aims to introduce to students the concept of varying galactic morphologies. Students will look in detail at images of numerous galaxies derived from the ‘Faulkes telescopes’ and they will attempt to classify them according to their own notion and then according to the Hubble Classification Scheme. Moreover, the class will try to investigate the origin of the shapes of the galaxies that stem from galaxy interactions using the “Galaxy Crash’ simulation., This date represents the date the author finished the indicated version of the Learning Object., This date represents the date the author finished authoring the metadata of the indicated version of the Learning Object., License: 'Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike'. For additional information or questions regarding copyright, distribution and reproduction, visit http://vishub.org/terms_of_use .
lli_description:

morphologies. Students will look in detail at images of numerous galaxies 
derived from the ‘Faulkes telescopes’ and they will attempt to classify 
them according to their own notion and then according to the Hubble 
Classification Scheme. Moreover, the class will try to investigate the origin 
of the shapes of the galaxies that stem from galaxy interactions using the 
“Galaxy Crash’ simulation.
